meals.recipe_name: Baked Salmon with Roasted Sweet Potatoes and Asparagus
Quinoa and Vegetable Stir-Fry with Free Range Eggs
Baked Salmon with Quinoa and Steamed Asparagus
Chickpea and Vegetable Curry with Brown Rice

recipes.name: Greek Yogurt and Avocado Toast
steps: Toast the whole wheat bread until lightly browned.
Mash the avocado and spread it over the toasted bread.
Top the avocado with Greek yogurt.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.name: Quinoa and Chickpea Salad
steps: Cook the quinoa according to package instructions.
In a large bowl, mix together the cooked quinoa and chickpeas.
Add the mixed vegetables to the bowl and toss to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.name: Baked Salmon with Roasted Sweet Potatoes and Asparagus
steps: Preheat the oven to 400Â°F (200Â°C).
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Place the salmon fillets on the baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes.
Toss the sweet potatoes with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Spread the sweet potatoes on a separate baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes.
Toss the asparagus with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Spread the asparagus on a separate baking sheet and roast for 12-15 minutes.

recipes.name: Lentil and Mushroom Omelette
steps: Whisk the eggs in a bowl and season with salt and pepper.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Add the mushrooms and cook until they release their moisture and start to brown.
Add the lentils to the pan and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
Pour the eggs over the mushroom and lentil mixture.
Cook until the eggs are almost set, then fold the omelette in half.

recipes.name: Grilled Chicken and Avocado Salad
steps: Grill the chicken breast until cooked through.
Mash the avocado and mix with the mixed vegetables.
Slice the grilled chicken and add it to the avocado mixture.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.name: Quinoa and Vegetable Stir-Fry with Free Range Eggs
steps: Cook the quinoa according to package instructions.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Add the mixed vegetables and cook until they start to soften.
Push the vegetables to one side of the pan.
Crack the eggs into the other side of the pan and scramble them.
Mix the eggs with the vegetables and cooked quinoa.

recipes.name: Greek Yogurt and Honey Parfait
steps: Layer the Greek yogurt, honey, and granola in a bowl.
Repeat the layers until all ingredients are used up.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Baked Salmon with Quinoa and Steamed Asparagus
steps: Preheat the oven to 400Â°F (200Â°C).
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Place the salmon fillets on the baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes.
Cook the quinoa according to package instructions.
Steam the asparagus until tender.
Serve the salmon with quinoa and asparagus.

recipes.name: Chickpea and Vegetable Curry with Brown Rice
steps: Cook the brown rice according to package instructions.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Add the mixed vegetables and cook until they start to soften.
Add the chickpeas to the pan and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
Add the curry sauce to the pan and stir to combine.
Serve the curry over the cooked brown rice.
